result.execSummary:
The defendant Katie M. Buchanan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  *Restitution joint & several with co-defendant in 16CM61 (each has prepaid $251.00 so restitution considered paid in full)  *Restitution to be paid out immediately.
*Payment Plan:  $50.00 per month, commencing on December 1, 2016

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katie M. Buchanan

defendant.name: Buchanan, Katie M.
defendant.address: 615 S. Market St., Lot #18, Westfield, WI 53964

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Katie M. Buchanan in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee met with the defendant and an offer was provided; the matter was reset to allow more time for the defendant to pay restitution.  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with the defendant; she has half today and her co-defendant has the other half to pay today.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Hendee asks the court to make an order finding the restitution be paid out to the victim per the supplement; the State waives the surcharge.  Atty Hendee also has a victim impact statement.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the offer.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney.    Court finds waiver of Attorney made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.    Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee files two documents; supplemental disposition for Restitution which includes the waived surcharge by the State and asks the court order that amount be paid today and the COC office to pay that out.    State has complied with victim notification requirements and files a victim impact statement.
Court reviews the statement.
Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Restitution is ordered per the supplement; Joint and Several with 16CM61, Debra Dahler. State waives the surcharge. Court orders the defendant pay $251 in restitution payment to the COC office today.  
Pay fine and costs = $379.00
DNA Sample + $200 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on December 1, 2016
  COC office to pay out Restitution as it is received.
Return date on October 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Katie M. Buchanan in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an offer was provided; however part of the offer was prepayment of restitution.  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with the defendant, she would like to go forward with the offer but needs some more time to pay restitution.  Defendant agrees and asks for 2 months as she is on maternity leave right now.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on July 12, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Return date on August 3, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Katie M. Buchanan in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Court questions the defendant.   Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and pre-trial  Return date scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Notice of Compliance (DA notifying victim of rights)
